org.webmacro.servlet
Interface TypeHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
CompositeTypeHandler, SimpleTypeHandler
public interface TypeHandler

Common empty interface for type handlers. Before an action method is invoked, each parameter value is passed to an assigned type handler, which performs the conversion of HTTP parameter value to a value of a Java type.

  • Example:

    Before the servlet action method:

     public Template doSomething(WebContext context, String str, int number) {...}
    is called, two ActionServlet internal type handlers for java.lang.String, which is passed the value of HTTP parameter named 'str', and int, which is passed the value of HTTP parameter named 'number', are invoked. Note: ActionServlet has defined handlers all primitive Java types.

  • Notifying ActionServlet about a type handler

    Handlers are loaded only once at ActionServlet startup according to the <servlet>_handlers.properties file (mandatory name), which has the format:

     # comment
 JavaType = fullyQualifiedTypeHandlerClass
    See SimpleTypeHandler and CompositeTypeHandler for examples.

See Also:
ActionServlet
